items.title: Liberal election autopsy delayed after Dutton suggests report defamatory
items.description: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

items.title: Trump vows tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland stand-off
items.description: Donald Trump announces the escalating tariffs for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland as a row over Greenland continues.

items.title: Putin's 'worst-case scenario' could be realised in Iran regime change
items.description: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

items.title: The CIA orchestrated an Iranian coup seven decades ago. It still haunts the US
items.description: Protesters are urging US President Donald Trump to help dismantle Iran's theocracy. If he answers the call, it won't be the first time the US government has toppled an Iranian government.

items.title: As a bushfire raged around them, a volunteer brigade made a plan to survive
items.description: The volunteer brigade from Terip Terip went through "hell" and back, narrowly escaping death, while fighting to save their own community and those nearby.

items.title: On the world's largest hospital ship volunteers give people a chance at a better life
items.description: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

items.title: BHP popular with investors as CBA loses its shine in market
items.description: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

items.title: Interpreter makes more than 200 errors in Supreme Court trial
items.description: A Victorian Supreme Court trial is forging ahead with amended transcripts after an interpreter made more than 200 translation errors during a key witness' evidence.

items.title: Sharks seek sea change as ocean temperatures rise
items.description: Several shark species are on the move as waters warm along Australia’s east coast. Here's how climate change is affecting the range of three major species.

items.title: Charging board or rent to adult children can help them and you
items.description: Experts on the benefit of charging board and expenses if you’re sharing a home with young adults, and how to calculate it.

items.title: Woman dies after tree falls on her car as winds lash NSW coast
items.description: Emergency services were called to the Illawarra Highway near Clover Hill Road just before 4pm after a tree branch fell onto a passing vehicle on a busy road.

items.title: Australian woman documents her stint in Chinese weight loss 'prison'
items.description: Camps offering intensive weight loss programs are on the rise in China as the country faces skyrocketing obesity rates.

items.title: Labor to cut racial vilification offence from hate speech bill after Greens signal opposition
items.description: The Albanese government will separate laws tightening gun control from its proposed hate speech reforms after the omnibus bill failed to secure the support of the Coalition and the Greens.

items.title: Australians urged to light a candle for Bondi victims on day of mourning
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese unveils further details of the national day of mourning to be held on January 22 after last month's Bondi terrorist attack.

items.title: Iran's leader Khamenei blames Trump for inciting deadly protests
items.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has labelled Donald Trump a criminal, blaming him for the deaths of thousands of demonstrators and security forces.

items.title: One woman's mission to heal a mining town in crisis
items.description: It started as a Facebook page and now it is a vital charity. Here is how this group run by grandmothers is fighting loneliness in the NSW Blue Mountains.

items.title: New year, new you? Ha. Let’s play… HARD!
items.description: Wow, you really don't quit. Let's see how poorly you perform this week.

items.title: Greenland is not for sale: thousands take to the streets of Denmark
items.description: Chanting "Greenland is not for sale" and carrying banners saying "Hands off Greenland", thousands of people have marched in Denmark, responding to US President Donald Trump's ambitions to acquire the Artic island.

items.title: 'Back to my best': Kerr's comeback continues with FA Cup double
items.description: Sam Kerr declares she is approaching her best form after scoring twice for Chelsea in a Women's FA Cup victory over Crystal Palace.

items.title: Calls for NSW police to end protest restrictions before Australia Day rallies
items.description: Lawyers, human rights advocates and civil libertarians are urging the NSW Police Commissioner not to extend a ban on authorised public assemblies as January 26 approaches.

items.title: Trump appoints son-in-law Jared Kushner to new Gaza 'Board of Peace'
items.description: The White House has released the names of leaders who will play a role in overseeing the next steps in Gaza, under the so-called "Board of Peace".

items.title: US Justice Department opens criminal investigation into Minnesota officials
items.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz says the federal justice system is being weaponised to intimidate Donald Trump's perceived political enemies.

items.title: Indonesian flight goes missing with 11 on board
items.description: Search and rescue crews have been deployed to the mountainous area of Maros Regency to look for the plane.

items.title: Crowds flock to beach sculpture to see the sun set upside down
items.description: Geraldton's Horizon Ball sculpture is drawing huge crowds of tourists after the spot gained international attention on social media.

items.title: Security vision shows terrifying speed of a new kind of climate-driven fire
items.description: A grassfire tore through Natimuk in minutes, overwhelming warnings and emergency response. Experts say it signals a dangerous new phase of bushfires.
